wiki.content: "Wherever You Will Go" is a song by The Calling released as the first single off their debut album Camino Palmero. The Wherever You Will Go Songfacts explains that it was written by guitarist Aaron Kamin after attending the funeral of his grandmother's best friend. She left behind a husband of 50 or more years and afterwards he started thinking of what it would be like to be him and have your whole life change so dramatically. It still remains their most renowned and their most successful hit, peaking at #5 on the Billboard Hot 100 and topping the Adult Top 40 for 23 weeks, setting a record for that chart behind Santana's hit song Smooth.
